intro: Rubus vulgaris f. carpinifolius, commonly known as the brambles with carpinifolius leaves, is a variant of the common blackberry. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, featuring a serrated margin and a unique shape resembling that of the carpinus tree. This plant typically grows in temperate regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces edible berries similar to those of the common blackberry. The plant is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges, contributing to local biodiversity.
